intro: Ceropegia angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces distinctive, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Ceropegia angustata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and unique floral structure.
